taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe cardueae;genus cirsium;species fontinale;variety fontinale

bio:treatment.description: Basal leaves: longer spines 4–6 mm; distal faces more densely glandular than tomentose. Cauline leaves: longer spines 8–12 mm. Distalmost stem bracts usually tightly subtending heads. Phyllaries 100–120, 35–45 of them reflexed; apical spines 1–2 mm; marginal spines often present. Cypselae 4.1–5 mm. 2n = 34, 34 + 1B.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety fontinale is known only from the vicinity of Crystal Springs Reservoir, San Mateo County.
